speaker: GRUMIO
text: Fie, fie on all tired jades, on all mad masters,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: and all foul ways! Was ever man so beaten? Was

speaker: GRUMIO
text: ever man so ’rayed? Was ever man so weary? I am

speaker: GRUMIO
text: sent before to make a fire, and they are coming

speaker: GRUMIO
text: after to warm them. Now were not I a little pot and

speaker: GRUMIO
text: soon hot, my very lips might freeze to my teeth, my

speaker: GRUMIO
text: tongue to the roof of my mouth, my heart in my

speaker: GRUMIO
text: belly, ere I should come by a fire to thaw me. But I

speaker: GRUMIO
text: with blowing the fire shall warm myself. For, considering

speaker: GRUMIO
text: the weather, a taller man than I will take

speaker: GRUMIO
text: cold.—Holla, ho, Curtis!

speaker: CURTIS
text: Who is that calls so coldly?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: A piece of ice. If thou doubt it, thou mayst

speaker: GRUMIO
text: slide from my shoulder to my heel with no greater

speaker: GRUMIO
text: a run but my head and my neck. A fire, good Curtis!

speaker: CURTIS
text: Is my master and his wife coming, Grumio?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Oh, ay, Curtis, ay, and therefore fire, fire! Cast

speaker: GRUMIO
text: on no water.

speaker: CURTIS
text: Is she so hot a shrew as she’s reported?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: She was, good Curtis, before this frost. But

speaker: GRUMIO
text: thou know’st winter tames man, woman, and

speaker: GRUMIO
text: beast, for it hath tamed my old master and my new

speaker: GRUMIO
text: mistress and myself, fellow Curtis.

speaker: CURTIS
text: Away, you three-inch fool, I am no beast!

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Am I but three inches? Why, thy horn is a

speaker: GRUMIO
text: foot, and so long am I, at the least. But wilt thou

speaker: GRUMIO
text: make a fire? Or shall I complain on thee to our

speaker: GRUMIO
text: mistress, whose hand (she being now at hand) thou

speaker: GRUMIO
text: shalt soon feel, to thy cold comfort, for being slow in

speaker: GRUMIO
text: thy hot office?

speaker: CURTIS
text: I prithee, good Grumio, tell me, how goes the

speaker: CURTIS
text: world?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: A cold world, Curtis, in every office but thine,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: and therefore fire! Do thy duty, and have thy duty,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: for my master and mistress are almost frozen to

speaker: GRUMIO
text: death.

speaker: CURTIS
text: There’s fire ready. And therefore, good Grumio,

speaker: CURTIS
text: the news!

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Why, “Jack boy, ho boy!” and as much news

speaker: GRUMIO
text: as wilt thou.

speaker: CURTIS
text: Come, you are so full of cony-catching.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Why, therefore fire, for I have caught extreme

speaker: GRUMIO
text: cold. Where’s the cook? Is supper ready, the house

speaker: GRUMIO
text: trimmed, rushes strewed, cobwebs swept, the servingmen

speaker: GRUMIO
text: in their new fustian, their white stockings,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: and every officer his wedding garment on? Be

speaker: GRUMIO
text: the Jacks fair within, the Jills fair without, the

speaker: GRUMIO
text: carpets laid, and everything in order?

speaker: CURTIS
text: All ready. And therefore, I pray thee, news.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: First, know my horse is tired, my master and

speaker: GRUMIO
text: mistress fallen out.

speaker: CURTIS
text: How?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Out of their saddles into the dirt, and thereby

speaker: GRUMIO
text: hangs a tale.

speaker: CURTIS
text: Let’s ha’ t, good Grumio.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Lend thine ear.

speaker: CURTIS
text: Here.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: There!

speaker: CURTIS
text: This ’tis to feel a tale, not to hear a tale.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: And therefore ’tis called a sensible tale. And

speaker: GRUMIO
text: this cuff was but to knock at your ear and beseech

speaker: GRUMIO
text: list’ning. Now I begin: Imprimis, we came down a

speaker: GRUMIO
text: foul hill, my master riding behind my mistress—

speaker: CURTIS
text: Both of one horse?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: What’s that to thee?

speaker: CURTIS
text: Why, a horse.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Tell thou the tale! But hadst thou not crossed

speaker: GRUMIO
text: me, thou shouldst have heard how her horse fell,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: and she under her horse; thou shouldst have heard

speaker: GRUMIO
text: in how miry a place, how she was bemoiled, how he

speaker: GRUMIO
text: left her with the horse upon her, how he beat me

speaker: GRUMIO
text: because her horse stumbled, how she waded

speaker: GRUMIO
text: through the dirt to pluck him off me, how he swore,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: how she prayed that never prayed before, how I

speaker: GRUMIO
text: cried, how the horses ran away, how her bridle was

speaker: GRUMIO
text: burst, how I lost my crupper, with many things of

speaker: GRUMIO
text: worthy memory which now shall die in oblivion,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: and thou return unexperienced to thy grave.

speaker: CURTIS
text: By this reck’ning, he is more shrew than she.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Ay, and that thou and the proudest of you all

speaker: GRUMIO
text: shall find when he comes home. But what talk I of

speaker: GRUMIO
text: this? Call forth Nathaniel, Joseph, Nicholas, Phillip,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Walter, Sugarsop, and the rest. Let their heads

speaker: GRUMIO
text: be slickly combed, their blue coats brushed, and

speaker: GRUMIO
text: their garters of an indifferent knit. Let them curtsy

speaker: GRUMIO
text: with their left legs, and not presume to touch a hair

speaker: GRUMIO
text: of my master’s horse-tail till they kiss their hands.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Are they all ready?

speaker: CURTIS
text: They are.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Call them forth.

speaker: CURTIS
text: Do you hear, ho? You must meet

speaker: CURTIS
text: my master to countenance my mistress.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Why, she hath a face of her own.

speaker: CURTIS
text: Who knows not that?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Thou, it seems, that calls for company to

speaker: GRUMIO
text: countenance her.

speaker: CURTIS
text: I call them forth to credit her.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Why, she comes to borrow nothing of them.

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: Welcome home, Grumio.

speaker: PHILLIP
text: How now, Grumio?

speaker: JOSEPH
text: What, Grumio!

speaker: NICHOLAS
text: Fellow Grumio!

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: How now, old lad?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Welcome, you!—How now, you?—What,

speaker: GRUMIO
text: you!—Fellow, you!—And thus much for greeting.

speaker: GRUMIO
text: Now, my spruce companions, is all ready and all

speaker: GRUMIO
text: things neat?

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: All things is ready. How near is our

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: master?

speaker: GRUMIO
text: E’en at hand, alighted by this. And therefore

speaker: GRUMIO
text: be not—Cock’s passion, silence! I hear my master.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Where
               
              be
               
              these
               
              knaves
              ?
               
              What
              ,
               
              no
               
              man
               
              at
               
              door

text:
To

You
               
              loggerheaded

Here

Did

Nathaniel’s

And

There

And

The

Go

Soud

Why

Off

It

              the

              of

As

Out

Take

And

Be

              Some

And

One

              sheets
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Ay
              ,
               
              and
               
              amid
               
              this
               
              hurly
               
              I
               
              intend

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
That
               
              all
               
              is
               
              done
               
              in
               
              reverend
               
              care
               
              of
               
              her
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
              ,
               
              in
               
              conclusion
              ,
               
              she
               
              shall
               
              watch
               
              all
               
              night
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
              ,
               
              if
               
              she
               
              chance
               
              to
               
              nod
              ,
               
              I’ll
               
              rail
               
              and
               
              brawl
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
               
              with
               
              the
               
              clamor
               
              keep
               
              her
               
              still
               
              awake
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
This
               
              is
               
              a
               
              way
               
              to
               
              kill
               
              a
               
              wife
               
              with
               
              kindness
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
And
               
              thus
               
              I’ll
               
              curb
               
              her
               
              mad
               
              and
               
              headstrong
               
              humor
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
He
               
              that
               
              knows
               
              better
               
              how
               
              to
               
              tame
               
              a
               
              shrew
              ,

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Now
               
              let
               
              him
               
              speak
              ;
               
              ’tis
               
              charity
               
              to
               
              shew
              .
